Title: About Us
Content:
trusted Old Age Home

Lar Santa Isabel and The Portuguese Welfare Society of South Africa

Lar Santa Isabel is a residential care facility managed by the Portuguese Welfare Society (PWS), located in Albertskroon, Johannesburg. The Portuguese Welfare Society, a registered Non-Profit Organisation (NPO Reg. No. 001-170), was founded in 1975 by members of Academia do Bacalhau, initially to assist Portuguese-speaking refugees from Angola and Mozambique. Over the years, the PWS has evolved into a vital support system for the Portuguese community in South Africa, focusing on aiding the elderly, vulnerable, and financially distressed individuals.

The need for a dedicated space to care for elderly Portuguese citizens led to the establishment of Lar Santa Isabel in the early 1990s, transforming an old school building into a home for seniors in need. The facility now offers a range of accommodation options, including Independent Living, Midcare (Intermediate Care), and Frailcare, with the capacity to accommodate up to 100 residents. Over 50% of the residents are supported by PWS’s charitable efforts, as they are unable to afford the full cost of their care.

Lar Santa Isabel is more than just a care facility—it is a community that celebrates the Portuguese language and culture. The home is staffed by over 57 dedicated employees, predominantly women, who provide 24-hour care and support in rotating shifts. Recent expansions have included a Frailcare Unit with 23 beds, an Intermediate Care section with individual rooms and dedicated staff facilities, and a new administrative block to streamline operations and better serve families and visitors.

The PWS’s commitment to providing care extends beyond the walls of Lar Santa Isabel. Through partnerships with Portuguese businesses, associations, and individuals—both locally and internationally—the PWS raises significant funds to support its welfare initiatives. One of its most anticipated events is the annual Magusto Festival, held each November, where families and friends gather to celebrate Portuguese heritage through traditional food, live music, and cultural entertainment. The festival not only brings the community together but also serves as a crucial fundraising event for PWS and Lar Santa Isabel.

In addition, the PWS operates a community store located onsite at Lar Santa Isabel, generating proceeds that are reinvested into resident activities and ongoing home projects. The Society also issues NPO certificates and Section 18A tax certificates for donations, ensuring it remains a transparent and responsible partner for corporate social investment and charitable giving.

With its deep-rooted values of compassion, dignity, and community, Lar Santa Isabel, under the management of the Portuguese Welfare Society, continues to be a place where elderly Portuguese citizens find care, companionship, and a sense of belonging.


Lar Rainha Santa Isabel

A well Established Portuguese Old Age Home in Johannesburg

Established in 1990, the Lar Rainha Santa Isabel is a Portuguese old age home located in Johannesburg, South Africa.

The home's philosophy emphasizes love, care, and dignity, aiming to provide a high quality of life for its residents.

35+

Year of Experience

950+

residents have called us home

Our Residents

Lar Santa Isabel warmly welcomes elderly individuals, with a focus on members of the Portuguese community but remaining inclusive of others from diverse backgrounds. Many of our residents contribute financially toward their living arrangements, while others receive assistance through the Portuguese Welfare Society of South Africa (PWS). This support ensures that every individual has access to the same high-quality care and resources, regardless of their financial situation. At Lar Santa Isabel, we cultivate a family-like atmosphere that emphasizes connection, comfort, and dignity, making it a true home where residents feel valued and supported in their daily lives.

Compassionate and professional elderly care tailored to individual needs.

A warm, Portuguese-speaking community that feels like home.

commitment to dignity, independence, and social connection for all residents.

Our Staff

Our dedicated team of caregivers, nurses, activity coordinators, chefs, and support staff plays an essential role in maintaining the compassionate environment of Lar Santa Isabel. Each staff member is trained to provide personalized care, ensuring that residents’ medical, emotional, and social needs are met with professionalism and empathy. From organizing engaging activities to preparing nutritious, culturally-inspired meals, our team is committed to enriching the lives of every resident. Their unwavering dedication is the foundation of our success, fostering trust and companionship while upholding the highest standards of respect and care.

Meet Our Board

Our Board of Directors leads with compassion and expertise, ensuring our home remains a place of dignity, care, and community for all our residents.

Title: requests for support
Content:
A Call for Compassion and Support

Dedicated to providing personalized support and companionship for our cherished senior residents.

Real people - Their Stories, Your Impact

At Lar Santa Isabel, we believe that every senior deserves to live their golden years with dignity, comfort, and care. Sadly, many of our residents have faced extraordinary hardships, financial struggles, loss of family support, and health challenges. Despite their resilience, they now depend on the kindness of compassionate individuals like you to provide for their essential needs.

From Service to Simple Need

Domingos Pinheiro

Mr Domingos Pinheiro is a resident of Lar Rainha Santa Isabel. He is affectionately known as “Domingos” and is a valued member of our Portuguese Community. Domingos' life has been shaped [… ]

Read domingos' full story

From Service to Simple Need

Mr Domingos Pinheiro is a resident of Lar Rainha Santa Isabel. He is affectionately known as “Domingos” and is a valued member of our Portuguese Community.

Domingos' life has been shaped by numerous profound challenges. At the age of 34, he endured the devastating loss of his wife. Not long after, tragedy struck again when his 17-year-old daughter passed away, leaving him grappling with unimaginable grief. These losses carved an irreplaceable void in his life and made the future feel deeply uncertain.

Adding to these hardships, Domingos later suffered a stroke that left him hospitalized for six long months. The road to recovery was arduous, both physically and emotionally, as his world seemed to come to a halt. It was during this difficult time that Nelson Reis introduced him to the Lar, a place that would come to play a pivotal role in his healing journey. Domingos arrived at the Lar in August 2009.

The Lar proved to be a sanctuary of recovery and purpose for Domingos. Within its welcoming community, he slowly regained his physical and mental strength. As his health improved, Domingos began contributing to the Lar by helping with maintenance, daily tasks, and offering support to fellow residents. These contributions provided him with a renewed sense of pride and purpose, allowing him to feel part of a meaningful community once more.

For several years, Domingos dedicated himself wholeheartedly to the Lar and its residents. However, with the departures of Fatima, Sandra, and Nelson, his services were no longer required. Despite this, he remains deeply grateful for the care and support the Lar offered him during his most challenging times.

Domingos has requested a donation of a new 3/4 bed for his room to improve his comfort and living conditions. For more information, kindly enquire at welfare@larstisabel.co.za.

While the pain of his past remains a part of him, Domingos continues to draw strength and hope from the community that gave him a second chance. The Lar not only helped him heal but also became a source of gratitude and a new beginning.

After Loss, Just One Request.

His journey of resilience, healing, and gratitude is an inspiration to us all. Domingos has requested a donation of a new 3/4 bed and mattress to support his ongoing needs. Want to help? Reach out to welfare@larstisabel.co.za.

One Illness Changed His Life

Ricardo Folgosa

Ricardo Folgosa is a resident of Lar Rainha Santa Isabel and a cherished member of our community. His life took an unexpected turn when he lost his job due to [... ]

Read ricardo's full story

One Illness Changed His Life

Ricardo Folgosa is a resident of Lar Rainha Santa Isabel and a cherished member of our community. His life took an unexpected turn when he lost his job due to a severe, life-threatening illness. The physical and emotional toll was overwhelming, but on August 13th, he was referred to the Lar by Dr. Garçes and Dr. Joâo Branco , marking the beginning of a transformative journey.

At the Lar, Ricardo received compassionate and professional care from Fatima Curado and the dedicated staff. The support he found, from medical attention to emotional encouragement, made the Lar a sanctuary during one of the darkest periods of his life. Slowly but surely, Ricardo began to recover, regaining both strength and hope.

After three to four months of rest and rehabilitation, Ricardo was ready to take the next step in life. Nelson Reis, a board member at the Lar, presented him with an opportunity to work at the Lar. Ricardo eagerly accepted, feeling deep gratitude for the care he had received and a strong desire to give back to the community. Contributing to the Lar while rebuilding his life proved incredibly motivating for him, providing renewed purpose and fulfilment.

Ricardo has also requested a donation of a pair of new Parrabellum shoes (size 9) to support his ongoing needs. For more information, kindly enquire at welfare@larstisabel.co.za.

Second Chance. One Simple Need.

After overcoming life-threatening challenges, Ricardo has found purpose and fulfillment within our community. He is currently in need of a a pair of new Parabellum shoes (size 9)  to improve his comfort. If you’d like to assist, please reach out to welfare@larstisabel.co.za.

A Life of Resilience and Independence

Edvilges Rodrigues (Eddie)

Eddie Rodrigues has faced many challenges in life, but she has always found a way to carry on with strength and independence. She comes from a small family and, over [… ]

read Eddie's full story

Surviving Against the Odds

Eddie Rodrigues has faced many challenges in life, but she has always found a way to carry on with strength and independence. She comes from a small family and, over the years, has lost the few loved ones she had. Her husband, an only child, passed away in 1991. Her only sister died about 15 years ago, leaving no children behind.

She has a son who holds a degree in architecture, but unfortunately, he has cut all ties with her. She does not know where he lives or if he is well. Due to the difficulties in finding stable employment in his field, he was often unemployed. They lived together until he left South Africa at the end of 2018.

Eddie was employed full-time until 2004 when the company she worked for closed down. Due to her age, she was only able to find temporary jobs thereafter. Now, she is entirely dependent on the SASSA old age pension for her daily needs.

She was accepted at Lar Santa Isabel thanks to the intervention of her old and dear friend, Margarida Freire. Margarida, who was living in one of the Lar’s houses, recognized Eddie’s difficult situation and approached the board on her behalf. Thanks to this act of kindness, Eddie found a safe and caring home at Lar Santa Isabel.

Eddie would greatly appreciate a laptop, as hers is no longer working. She is open to receiving a second-hand or refurbished device if a new one is not possible. Any assistance in fulfilling this request would mean the world to her.

Help Eddie Stay Connected with a Laptop!

Eddie has faced many hardships but remains resilient. She would love to have a laptop, as hers has stopped working. A second-hand device would be just as appreciated as a new one! If you can assist, please contact welfare@larstisabel.co.za.

Title: frail care
Content:
Frail Care with dignity

Your loved one deserves more than care - We offer Frail Care with dignity and love

Comprehensive Frail Care in Johannesburg for Your Loved One

Our dedicated team assists with:

Medication management and medical monitoring
Bathing, dressing, and feeding assistance
Emotional and social support for overall well-being
Palliative and end-of-life care with dignity and respect

At Lar Santa Isabel, we go beyond just providing care – we create a home-like environment where seniors feel valued, safe, and well cared for.

Our Frailcare Option

Sharing Room

R21 060.00 p/m

24/7 Nursing & Medical Supervision
Medication management and medical monitoring
On-site GP visits and emergency medical response
Personalized Care Plans

View More Care Level Options

Midcare Option

Independent Living option

Flatlets option

Beyond addressing physical health needs

At Lar Rainha Santa Isabel, we believe in a holistic approach to senior care. Beyond addressing physical health needs, we focus on nurturing the emotional, social, and spiritual well-being of our residents. Our dedicated team organizes regular activities, including music therapy, art sessions, and cultural events, to engage residents and foster a sense of community. We also provide spiritual support through regular services and personal counseling, respecting each individual's beliefs and traditions. This comprehensive approach ensures that our residents not only receive exceptional medical care but also lead fulfilling and enriched lives within our Portuguese community.

We're Thorough With our care

Discover the peace of mind that comes with round-the-clock expert care

Proffesional, 24/7 Nursing Care

Round-the-clock support by qualified nurses who specialise in elderly and frail care, ensuring safety and comfort at all times.

On-Site Medical Supervision

Regular visits from a general practitioner and quick access to emergency medical services provide peace of mind for families and residents alike.

Daily Assistance with Personal Needs

Compassionate caregivers assist with bathing, dressing, grooming, mobility, and feeding – all in a respectful, dignified manner.

Nutritious Portuguese Meals

Our kitchen prepares three delicious, home-style meals daily, including traditional Portuguese favourites that bring comfort and familiarity.

Therapy and Rehabilitation Support

Residents have access to physiotherapy and occupational therapy services, promoting mobility, balance, and independence.

Medication Management

Our staff administer and monitor prescribed medication, maintaining accurate records to prevent complications or missed doses.

Palliative and End-of-Life Care

Gentle, compassionate care is offered to residents in their final stages of life, ensuring comfort, dignity, and emotional support for families.

Stimulating Daily Activities

Cognitive and social activities such as puzzles, storytelling, singing, and games help maintain engagement and improve quality of life.

Safe and Accessible Environment

Fully secure premises with wheelchair-friendly facilities, emergency call buttons, and staff always on hand to assist.

Portuguese-Style Dining

Dining at Lar Santa Isabel is a celebration of Portuguese culinary heritage, providing residents with delicious, home-cooked meals crafted with care. Each dish is prepared using fresh, high-quality ingredients and imbued with the authentic flavors of traditional Portuguese cuisine, ensuring that meals are both nutritious and comforting. Our menu rotates monthly to offer variety while honoring classic recipes that resonate with our residents’ tastes and memories. Meals are enjoyed in a welcoming communal setting, encouraging interaction and togetherness. With a focus on providing a true taste of home, dining at Lar Santa Isabel fosters connections through shared cultural experiences and delightful food.

Take the next step

At Lar Santa Isabel, we make the transition seamless and stress-free.

The Process

Initial Consultation

We conduct a personalized assessment to understand the senior’s health, personal preferences, and level of care required.

Customized Care Plan

A dedicated caregiver and medical team create an individualized plan that covers:
Daily personal care needs.
Medical monitoring & medication schedules.
Engagement in activities suited to the resident’s interests.

Move-in & Family Support

Residents are welcomed into a warm, home-like setting.
Families are encouraged to visit and participate in care discussions.
We ensure a smooth adjustment period with regular updates.

Title: midcare
Content:
Support, intermediate Care for the elderly

Not quite frail, but not quite independent? Perfect middle ground.

Personalized Support Plans for Every Resident

At Lar Rainha Santa Isabel, we recognize that no two residents are the same. Our team works closely with residents and their families to create personalized support plans tailored to individual needs, preferences, and health goals. Whether a resident requires assistance with mobility, managing a medical condition, or simply a little extra help with daily routines, we ensure their care evolves as they do. By honoring individuality and fostering independence, our intermediate care for the elderly provides a supportive bridge between assisted living and more intensive frail care services.

Intermediate Care for the elderly

Our dedicated team assists with:

Medication management and medical monitoring
Bathing, dressing, and feeding assistance
Emotional and social support for overall well-being
Private or shared rooms designed for comfort and a homely feel.

At Lar Rainha Santa Isabel, we go beyond just providing care – we create a home-like environment where seniors feel valued, safe, and well cared for.

Our Midcare option

Sharing Room

R14 650.00 p/m

Sharing Bathroom

Health monitoring and chronic care support
Social and cultural activity programme
Transportation for medical appointments
3 daily meals plus snacks
Private Room

Care Without Compromise

The ideal solution for ageing with grace and gentle support

Assistance with Daily Living

Support for basic needs like personal hygiene, dressing, and meals – delivered with patience and care.

Part-Time Nursing Supervision

Regular check-ins by nursing staff to monitor health and offer support as needed, without limiting independence.

Specialized Dementia & Alzheimer’s Care

We offer a secure, structured environment for those with memory-related conditions.

Chronic Condition Monitoring

Ongoing management of diabetes, high blood pressure, or other conditions, coordinated with doctors and family members.

Therapy on Demand

Access to physical or occupational therapy services, either on-site or through partnered professionals.

Housekeeping and Laundry Services

We take care of cleaning and laundry, allowing residents to relax and enjoy a stress-free lifestyle.

Social and Cultural Activities

Daily programmes include games, arts, exercise classes, and Portuguese cultural celebrations to keep spirits high.

Family Communication and Support

We maintain regular contact with families and encourage visits, keeping loved ones connected and informed.

Secure Living with Emergency Response

24-hour security and emergency support systems ensure safety at all times.

Traditional Portuguese Meals

At Lar Rainha Santa Isabel, every meal is a little taste of home. We serve hearty, home-cooked Portuguese dishes made with love and fresh, high-quality ingredients. From comforting stews to golden custard tarts, our rotating monthly menu brings variety while staying true to traditional recipes our residents know and love. Meals are enjoyed together in a warm, communal setting, because good food is even better when shared. For us, dining isn’t just about nourishment; it’s about connection, culture, and joy.

Title: Privacy Policy
Content:
DATA PROTECTION, COOKIE AND PRIVACY POLICY

Last Modified

Privacy Policy

 

 

 

 

Lar Santa Isabel Pty Ltd (“Lar Santa Isabel”) places a high premium on the privacy and personal information of our members, employees, service providers, stakeholders, business partners and any other third-party with whom we engage or contract. Lar Santa Isabel is therefore committed to ensure that it complies with the requirements of the Protection of Personal Information Act, 4 of 2013 (“POPIA”) and other potentially applicable data protection and privacy laws.

 

 

 

 

 

1.    DEFINITIONS

In this Policy (as defined below), unless the context requires otherwise, the following capitalised terms shall have the meanings given to them —

1.1          "Active Processing" refers to instances where the Company has directly been provided with the Personal Information/Personal Data of Data Subjects, such as when Data Subjects submit an enquiry in respect of the Company’s products and/or services, or when Data Subjects provide Personal Information/Personal Data to Lar Santa Isabel pursuant to concluding any commercial agreement(s) with the Company;

1.2          "Applicable Laws" mean any laws applicable to Personal Data and Personal Information and include any statute, regulation, notice, policy, directive, ruling or subordinate legislation; the common law; any binding court order, judgment or ruling, policy or standard enforceable by law; or any applicable direction, policy or order that is given by any regulator, competent authority or organ of state or statutory industry body;

1.3          "Child" means any natural person under the age of 18 years;

1.4          "Competent Person" means anyone who is legally competent to consent to any action or decision being taken by any matter concerning a child, for example a parent or legal guardian;

1.5          “Company” means The Portuguese Welfare Society of South Africa, with registration number: NPO No: 001-170 / PBO: 930 004 911

1.6          "Controller" means Lar Santa Isabel, in circumstances where it Processes Personal Data (as defined in Article 4 of the GDPR);

1.7          "Cookies" means small text files that store either Non-personally Identifiable Information/Data or Personal Information/Personal Data about Data Subjects, either temporarily in connection with a Data Subjects Internet Protocol (IP) address (known as a temporary or session cookie and deleted once a Data Subject closes their browser window) or more permanently on the hard drive of a Data Subject’s device or for purposes of remembering the Website(s) settings (known as a permanent or persistent cookie, or flash cookies). The Company’s Website(s) and/or or Mobile Application(s) may from time to time make use of sessions, persistent or flash cookies so that Data Subjects do not have to fill in the same information from page to page within our Website(s) or Mobile Application(s) and to enhance any Data Subject’s experience of the Company’s Website and/or Mobile Application(s). If Data Subjects elect not to receive cookies, they may be able to view some, but not all of the content on the Company’s Website(s) or Mobile Application(s);

1.8          "Data Subject" means the person or any Third-Party who accesses the website of Lar Santa Isabel and Processes Personal Information/Personal Data;

1.9          "Embedded Scripts" means, programming code that is designed to collect information about a Data Subject’s interactions with the relevant Website(s) or Mobile Application(s). It is temporarily downloaded onto a Data Subject’s device from the Lar Santa Isabel’s web server or a Third-Party Operator. This program is active only while a Data Subject is connected to the relevant Website(s) or Mobile Application(s) and is deleted or deactivated thereafter;

1.10       "GDPR" means Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of the European Union of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regards to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC, more commonly referred to as the General Data Protection Regulation;

1.11       "Inactive Processing" refers to instances where Lar Santa Isabel has not actively been provided with the Personal Information/Personal Data of Data Subjects, such as when the Company deploys Passive Processing Means to collect information from Data Subjects. These Passive Processing Means allow the Company to Process certain kinds of Non-personally Identifiable Data which can perhaps not be linked to Data Subjects;

1.12       "Member" means any natural person who has concluded an agreement with the Company in terms of which such member enjoys pre-determined, tailored and personalized benefits against payment of monthly premiums of contributions;?

1.13       "Member Portal" means the digital portal to which a Member has access to manage their individual membership profile;

1.14       "Mobile Application" means the Company’s digital mobile application interface which enables Members to manage their individual membership profile;

1.15       "Mobile Device Identifier" means device information that can be identified when accessing the Company’s Website or Mobile Application(s) through mobile devices. Certain features of the relevant Website(s) or Mobile Application(s) may require collection of mobile phone numbers and the Company may associate that phone number with the mobile device identifiers. Additionally, some mobile phone service providers operate systems that pinpoint the physical location of devices that use their service. Depending on the provider, the Company and/or our Third-Party Operators may receive this information. If the Company associates any such passively collected information with the Personal Information/Personal Data of Data Subjects, the Company will treat the

 

combined information as Personal Information/Personal Data as contemplated in this Policy;

1.16       "Non-personally Identifiable Information/Data" means any information/data which cannot be linked to Data Subjects, such as an internet domain name, the type of web browser used by a Data Subject, the type of operating system relied on by a Data Subject, the date and time of a Data Subject’s visit to the Company’s Website and Mobile Application(s), the specific pages a Data Subject may have visited, and the address of the website which a Data Subjects may have visited prior to entering or gaining access to the Company’s Website or Mobile Application(s);

1.17       "Operator" means a person or entity who Processes Personal Information/Data for a Responsible Party;

1.18       "Passive Processing Means " means the use of technologies to facilitate the Inactive Processing of Personal Information/Personal Data, namely the use of Cookies, Web Beacons, Embedded Scripts and/or Mobile Device Identifiers;

1.19       "Personal Data" (as defined in Article 4 of the GDPR) means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person ('data subject'); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly;

1.20       "Personal Information" shall have the same meaning as in section 1 of POPIA and shall include an Account Number as defined in section 105(5) of POPIA;

1.21       "Policy" means this Data Protection and Privacy Policy;

1.22       "POPIA" means the Protection of Personal Information Act, No 4 of 2013;

1.23       "Processing" means any operation or activity or any set of operations, whether or not by automatic means, concerning Personal Information/Personal Data, including:

1.23.1   the collection, receipt, recording, organisation, collation, storage, updating or modification, retrieval, alteration, consultation or use;

1.23.2   dissemination by means of transmission, distribution or making available in any other form by electronic communications or other means; or

1.23.3   merging, linking, blocking, degradation, erasure or destruction. For the purposes of this definition, "Process" has a corresponding meaning and the terms “Processing” and “Process” shall include instances or activities of Active Processing, Inactive or Passive Processing of Personal Information/Personal Data and/or Non-Personally Identifiable Information/Data;

1.24       "Regulator(s)" means any applicable regulatory authority, including the Information Regulator established in terms of POPIA;

1.25       "Responsible Party" means in the context of this Policy, the Company;

 

1.26       "Special Personal Information/Data" means Personal Information/Personal Data concerning, amongst other aspects contemplated in terms of section 26 Part B of POPIA, a Data Subject's religious beliefs, race or ethnic origin, trade union membership, political persuasion, health or sex life, biometric data, or criminal behaviour;

1.27       "Third Party" means any employee, independent contractor, agent, consultant, broker, managed healthcare services provider, sub-contractor, Regulator(s), user of the Company’s websites or mobile application interfaces, or other representative of the Company;

1.28       "Website" means the website owned and operated by the Company sourced at www.larstisabel.co.za;

1.29       "Web Beacons" means small graphic images called web beacons, also known as “Internet tags” or “clear gifs,”, which Web Beacons may be deployed in the Company’s Website pages and e-mail messages. Web beacons may be invisible to Data Subjects, but any electronic image inserted into a web page or e-mail can act as a Web Beacon. The Company may use web beacons or similar technologies for a number of purposes, including, without limitation, to count the number of visitors to its Website, Mobile Application(s), to monitor how users navigate the Website or Mobile Application(s), to count how many e-mails that the Company has sent were actually opened or to count how many particular articles or links were actually viewed by Data Subjects in certain circumstances.

 

2.    INTRODUCTION

2.1  This Policy regulates the Processing of Personal Information/Personal Data by the Company and sets forth the requirements with which the Company undertakes to comply when Processing Personal Information/Personal Data pursuant to undertaking its operations and fulfilling its contractual obligations in respect of Data Subjects and Third Parties in general.

2.2  The Company places a high premium on the privacy of every person or organisation with whom it interacts or engages and therefore acknowledges the need to ensure that Personal Information/Personal Data is handled with a reasonable standard of care as may be expected from it. The Company is therefore committed to ensuring that it complies with the requirements of POPIA, and also with the terms of the GDPR to the

 

       extent that the GDPR applies.

2.3  The core purpose of the GDPR is recorded as protecting the Personal Information/Personal Data belonging to citizens and residents of the European Union. Therefore, although the Company operates within the Republic of South Africa, the GDPR may apply to it in certain circumstances and in such circumstances, the Company will take appropriate compliance steps. At the time of publishing this Policy, the circumstances in respect of which the GDPR may be applicable to the Company are:

2.3.1     Instances where the Company offers goods or services to data subjects who are physically within the European Union; or

2.3.2     Instances where the Company monitors the online activities and/or behaviour of data subjects who visit the Company’s Website(s) from within the European Union.

2.4  When a Data Subject or Third Party engages with the Company, whether physically or via any digital, electronic interface such as the Company’s Website, Member Portal or Mobile Application, the Data Subject or Third Party acknowledges that they trust the Company to Process their Personal Information/Personal Data.

2.5  When accessing Company’s website, Data Subjects and Third Parties have the right to object to the processing of their Personal Information/Personal Data. It is voluntary to accept the Terms and Conditions to which this Policy relates. However, the Company does require the Data Subject or Third Party’s acceptance to enable the proper use of the Company’s Website, Member Portal or Mobile Application.

 

3.    PURPOSE AND APPLICATION

3.1          The purpose of this Policy is not only to inform Data Subjects about how the Company Processes their Personal Information/Personal Data, but also to establish a standard by which the Company and its employees and representatives shall comply in as far as the Processing of Personal Information/Personal Data is concerned.

3.2          The Company, in its capacity as a Responsible Party and/or Operator and/or Controller, as the case may be, shall observe and comply with its obligations under POPIA and the GDPR (as may be applicable and to the extent necessary) when it Processes Personal Information/Personal Data from or in respect of any Data Subject.

 

4.            COLLECTING AND PROCESSING OF PERSONAL INFORMATION/PERSONAL DATA

4.1          Whenever any Data Subject completes an application form, contacts the Company electronically, or uses one of the products, services, facilities, tools or utilities offered by the Company through its Website, Member Portal or Mobile Application, the Company will in effect be Processing the Data Subject’s Personal Information/Personal Data.

4.2          It may be from time to time that the Company has collected a Data Subject’s Personal Information/Personal Data from other sources. In the event that a Data Subject has shared their Personal Information/Personal Data with any Third Parties, the Company will not be responsible for any loss suffered by the Data Subject, their dependants, beneficiaries, spouse(s) or employees (as the case may be).

4.3          When a Data Subject provides the Company with the Personal Information of their dependant(s) either through the Website, Member Portal, Mobile Application or on their membership application, the Data Subject confirms having obtained consent to do so from his/her affiliated company or place of employment, and the Company will process the Personal Information/Personal Data of such affiliate(s) or place of employment(s) in line with this Policy, as well as the terms and conditions to which this Policy relates.

4.4          The Company will Process Personal Information/Personal Data in order to facilitate and enhance the delivery of products and services to its Members, foster a legally compliant workplace environment, as well as safeguard the Personal Information/Personal Data relating any Data Subjects which it in fact holds. In such an instance, the Data Subject providing the Company with such Personal Information/Personal Data will confirm that they are a Competent Person and that they have authority to give the requisite consent to enable the Company to process such Personal Information/Personal Data.

4.5          The Company undertakes to process any Personal Information/Personal Data in a manner which promotes the constitutional right to privacy, retains accountability and Data Subject participation. In supplementation of the above, the Company will process Personal Information/Personal Data for the following purposes:

4.5.1     To provide or manage any information, products and/or services requested by Data Subjects in general and our Members;

4.5.2     To establish a Data Subject’s needs, wants and preferences in relation to the products and/or services provided by the Company;

4.5.3     To help the Company identify Data Subjects when they contact the Company;

4.5.4     To facilitate the delivery of products and/or services to Members, including Disease Management;

 

4.5.5     To allocate to data subjects/affiliates/place of employment unique identifiers for the purpose of securely storing, retaining and recalling such Members’ Personal Information/Personal Data from time to time;

4.5.6     To maintain records of Data Subjects and specifically Member records;

4.5.7     To maintain Third-Party records;

4.5.8     For recruitment purposes;

4.5.9     For employment purposes;

4.5.10   For apprenticeship purposes;

4.5.11   For general administration purposes;

4.5.12   For legal and/or contractual purposes;

4.5.13   For health and safety purposes;

4.5.14   To retain the records of brokers;

4.5.15   To monitor access, secure and manage any facilities owned or operated by the Company regardless of location in South Africa;

4.5.16   To transact with Third Parties;

4.5.17   To improve the quality of the Company’s products and services;

4.5.18   To detect and prevent money laundering;

4.5.19   To analyse the Personal Information/Personal Data collected for research and statistical purposes;

4.5.20   To help recover bad debts;

4.5.21   To transfer Personal Information/Personal Data across the borders of South Africa to other jurisdiction if reasonably required;

4.5.22   To carry out analysis and company profiling;

4.6          When collecting Personal Information/Personal Data from a Data Subject, the Company shall comply with the notification requirements as set out in Section 18 of POPIA, and to the extent applicable, Articles 13 and 14 of the GDPR.

4.7          The Company will collect and Process Personal Information/Personal Data in compliance with the conditions as set out in POPIA and/or the Processing principles in the GDPR (as the case may be), to ensure that it protects the Data Subject's privacy.

4.8          The Company will not Process the Personal Information/Personal Data of a Data Subject for any purpose other than for the purposes set forth in this Policy, unless the Company is permitted or required to do so in terms of Applicable Laws or otherwise by law.

4.9          The Company may from time-to-time Process Personal Information/Personal Data by

 

making use of automated means (without deploying any human intervention in the decision-making process) to make decisions about the Data Subject or their application. In this instance it is specifically recorded that the Data Subject may object to or query the outcomes of such a decision.

 

5.            PERSONAL INFORMATION/PERSONAL DATA FOR DIRECT MARKETING PURPOSES

5.1          The Company acknowledges that it may only use Personal Information/Personal Data to contact Data Subjects for purposes of direct marketing where the Company has complied with the provisions of POPIA and GDPR (where applicable) and when it is generally permissible to do so in terms of Applicable Laws.

5.2          The Company will ensure that a reasonable opportunity is given to all Data Subjects to object (opt-out) to the use of their Personal Information/Personal Data for the Company's marketing purposes when collecting the Personal Information/Personal Data and on the occasion of each communication to the Data Subject for purposes of direct marketing.

 

6.            STORAGE AND RETENTION OF PERSONAL INFORMATION/PERSONAL DATA

6.1          The Company will retain Personal Information/Data it has Processed, in an electronic or hardcopy file format on its own accord and/or with a Third-Party service provider appointed for this purpose (the provisions of clause 9 below will apply in this regard).

6.2          Personal Information/Personal Data will only be retained by the Company for as long as necessary to fulfil the purposes for which that Personal Information/Personal Data was collected and/or as permitted in terms of Applicable Law.

6.3          It is specifically recorded that any Data Subject has the right to object to the Processing of their Personal Information and the Company shall retain and store the Data Subject’s Personal Information/Personal Data for the purposes of dealing with such an objection or enquiry as soon and as swiftly as possible. In the event the Data Subject objects to the Processing of their Personal Information you agree to forthwith vacate the website.

6.4          In amplification of the above, and in as far as the provisions of Article 17 of the GDPR are applicable to the Company’s processing of Personal Information/Personal Data of Data Subjects, any Data Subject shall have the right to procure from the Company the erasure of any Personal Information/Personal Data concerning the Data Subject. Such erasure will be given effect as soon as possibly pursuant to such a request and will be subject to the Data Subject satisfying the Company as to the applicability of any of the circumstances justifying such erasure under Article 17 of the GDPR.

 

7.            FAILURE TO PROVIDE PERSONAL INFORMATION

7.1          Where the Company is required to collect Personal Information/Personal Data from a Data Subject by law or in order to fulfil a legitimate business purpose of the Company and the Data Subject fails to provide such Personal Information/Personal Data, the Company may, on notice to the Data Subject, decline to render services without any liability to the Data Subject.

 

8.            SECURING PERSONAL INFORMATION/PERSONAL DATA

8.1          The Company has implemented appropriate, reasonable, physical, organisational, contractual and technological security measures to secure the integrity and confidentiality of Personal Information/Personal Data, including measures to protect against the loss or theft, unauthorised access, disclosure, copying, use or modification of Personal Information/Personal Data in compliance with Applicable Laws.

8.2          In further compliance with Applicable Law, the Company will take steps to notify the relevant Regulator(s) and/or any affected Data Subjects in the event of a security breach and will provide such notification as soon as reasonably possible after becoming aware of any such breach.

8.3          Notwithstanding any other provisions of this Policy, it should be acknowledged that the transmission of Personal Information/Personal Data, whether it be physically in person, via the internet or any other digital data transferring technology, is not completely secure. Although the Company has taken all appropriate, reasonable measures contemplated in clause 8.1 above to secure the integrity and confidentiality of the Personal Information/Personal Data it Processes, in order to guard against the loss of, damage to or unauthorised destruction of Personal Information/Personal Data and unlawful access to or processing of Personal Information/Personal Data, the Company in no way guarantees that its security system is completely secure or error free. Therefore, the Company does not guarantee the security or accuracy of the information (whether it be Personal Information/Personal Data or not) which it collects from any Data Subject.

8.4          Any transmission of Personal Information/Personal Data will be solely at the own risk of the Data Subject. Once the Company has received the Personal Information/Personal Data, it will deploy and use strict procedures and security features to try to prevent unauthorised access to it. As indicated above, the Company’s reiterates that it restricts access to Personal Information/Personal Data to Third Parties who have a legitimate operational reason for having access to such Personal Information/Personal Data. The Company also maintains electronic and procedural safeguards that comply with the

Applicable Laws to protect the Data Subject’s Personal Information from any unauthorised access.

8.5          The Company shall not be held responsible and by accepting the terms and conditions to which this Policy relates, any Data Subject agrees to indemnify and hold the Company harmless for any security breaches which may potentially expose the Personal Information/Personal Data in the Company’s possession to unauthorised access and or the unlawful Processing of such Personal Information/Personal Data by any Third Party.

 

9.            PROVISION OF PERSONAL INFORMATION/PERSONAL DATA TO THIRD PARTIES

9.1          The Company may disclose Personal Information/Personal Data to Third-Party service providers where necessary and to achieve the purpose(s) for which the Personal Information/Personal Data was originally collected and Processed. The Company will enter into written agreements with such Third-Party service providers to ensure that they comply with Applicable Laws pursuant to the Processing of Personal Information/Personal Data provided to it by the Company from time to time.

9.2          In as far as the provisions of the GDPR may be applicable to the Company’s processing of Personal Information/Personal Data, the Data Subject has the right, under the provisions of Article 20 of the GDPR, to receive any Personal Information/Personal Data which the Data Subject has provided to the Company, in a structured, commonly used and machine-readable format, as well as to transmit that Personal Information/Personal Data to another third party. Such transmittal shall be subject to the conditions set forth in Article 20 and any transfer of a Data Subject’s Personal Information/Personal Data in this regard, will be subject to the Data Subject indemnifying the Company against any potential loss or damage which may be suffered by the Data Subject as a result of such transfer.

 

10.          TRANSFER OF PERSONAL INFORMATION/PERSONAL DATA OUTSIDE OF SOUTH AFRICA

10.1       The Company may, under certain circumstances, transfer Personal Information/Personal Data to a jurisdiction outside of the Republic of South Africa in order to achieve the purpose(s) for which the Personal Information/Data was collected and Processed, including for Processing and storage by Third-Party service providers.

10.2       The Company will obtain the Data Subject's consent to transfer the Personal Information/Personal Data to such foreign jurisdiction unless consent is not required by Applicable Law.

 

10.3       The Data Subject should also take note that, where the Personal Information/Personal Data is transferred to a foreign jurisdiction, the Processing of Personal Information/Personal Data in the foreign jurisdiction may be subject to the laws of that foreign jurisdiction.

 

11.          ACCESS TO PERSONAL INFORMATION/PERSONAL DATA

11.1       A Data Subject has the right to a copy of the Personal Information/Personal Data which is held by the Company (subject to a few limited exemptions as provided for under Applicable Law).

11.2       The Data Subject must make a written request (which can be by email) to the Information Officer designated by the Company from time to time.

11.3       The Company will provide the Data Subject with any such Personal Information /Personal Data to the extent required by Applicable Law and subject to and in accordance with the provisions of the Companys PAIA Manual (published in terms of section 51 of the Promotion of Access to Information Act, 2000 (“PAIA”), which PAIA Manual can be sourced from the email manager@larstisabel.co.za.

11.4       The Data Subject can challenge the accuracy or completeness of his/her/its Personal Information/Personal Data in the Company's records at any time in accordance with the process set out in the Company's PAIA Manual.

 

12.          KEEPING PERSONAL INFORMATION/PERSONAL DATA ACCURATE

12.1       The Company will take reasonable steps to ensure that Personal Information/Personal Data that it Processes is kept updated where reasonably possible. For this purpose, the Company has provided a function on its Member Portal? to enable Data Subjects to update their information.

12.2       The Company may not always expressly request the Data Subject to verify and update his/her/its Personal Information/Personal Data and expects that the Data Subject will notify the Company from time to time in writing:

12.2.1   of any updates or amendments required in respect of his/her/its Personal Information/Personal Data;

12.2.2   where the Data Subject requires the Company to delete his/her/its Personal Information/Personal Data; or

12.2.3   where the Data Subject wishes to restrict the Processing of his/her/its Personal Information/Personal Data.

 

13.          COSTS TO ACCESS PERSONAL INFORMATION/PERSONAL DATA

The prescribed fees to be paid for copies of the Data Subject's Personal Information/Personal Data are listed in the Company's PAIA Manual referred to in clause 11.3 above.

13.1       The Company reserves the right to make amendments to this Policy from time to time.

 

 

14.          COMPLAINTS TO THE INFORMATION REGULATOR

14.1       In the event that any Data Subject or Third Party is of the view or belief that the Company has Processed their Personal Information/Personal Data in a manner or for a purpose which is contrary to the provisions of this Policy, the Data Subject is required to first attempt to resolve the matter directly with the Company, failing which the Data Subject or Third Party shall have the right to lodge a complaint with the Information Regulator, under the provisions of POPIA.

 

14.2       The contact particulars of the Information Regulator are:

The Information Regulator (South Africa) Forum III 3rd Floor Braampark

PO Box 31533

Braamfontein, Johannesburg, 2107

 

Mr. Marks Thibela Chief Executive Officer

Tel No: +27 010 023 5207

Cell No: 082 746 4173

E-mail: inforeg@justice.gov.za

 

 

15.          CONTACTING US

All comments, questions, concerns or complaints regarding Personal Information/Personal Data or this Policy should be emailed to the Company's Information Officer at talktous@larstisabel.co.za.

 

 

16.  EFFECTIVE DATE

The Policy shall apply and take effect on 1 APRIL 2025.

Title: Independent living
Content:
Independent Living with Heart, Heritage, and Freedom

a New Chapter of Freedom and Care

At Lar Rainha Santa Isabel, our Independent Living option is designed for seniors who cherish their independence but appreciate the comfort of supportive services close by. Residents enjoy the privacy of their own room, delicious daily meals, housekeeping, and a vibrant social community – all within a secure, Portuguese-speaking environment. Whether you seek a maintenance-free lifestyle or simply the peace of mind of having assistance on hand if needed, our independent living spaces offer the perfect blend of autonomy, connection, and culture. Live life fully, surrounded by familiar traditions and heartfelt care.

Comprehensive Care for Your Loved One

Our dedicated team assists with:

Housekeeping and laundry services
Emotional and social support for overall well-being
Enjoy balanced, home cooked meals
Maintaining their lifestyle with some backup

At Lar Santa Isabel, we go beyond just providing care – we create a home-like environment where seniors feel valued, safe, and well cared for.

Independent Living Option

Private Room

R11 600.00 p/m

Sharing Bathroom

Secure premises with emergency response
Daily meals provided
Cultural and religious celebrations
Private room with shared bathroom
Private Room

R13 500.00 p/m

Private Bathroom

Daily meals provided
Cultural and religious celebrations
Secure premises with emergency response
Private room with en-suite bathroom

View More Care Level Options

Frailcare Option

Midcare Option

Flatlets option

Every Detail Matters

Live your golden years with freedom, and never wash a dish again

Private Accommodation with Shared Community Spaces

Enjoy your own private room and bathroom, with access to communal lounges, gardens, and dining areas.

Daily Support Services Included

All residents benefit from regular housekeeping, laundry services, and delicious daily meals – ensuring a stress-free, comfortable lifestyle without the chores.

On-Demand Medical Access

Independent living with access to medical care, nurses, and caregivers if required.

Freedom and Flexibility

Residents are free to come and go as they please, maintaining their lifestyle with a bit of backup when needed.

Pamper Sessions and Fun Activities

From Manicures and hairdressing to bingo, and music therapy – we offer regular pamper sessions and engaging activities that make each day special and enjoyable.

Cultural Enrichment

Celebrate Portuguese heritage with traditional music, food, and community events that honour our roots.

Community Dining Options

Shared meals are available in our dining hall, offering nutritious food and great conversation with neighbours.

Supportive Environment for Aging in Place

Residents can transition to higher levels of care within the same community if their needs change over time.

Safe and Relaxed Setting

Live independently while enjoying the reassurance of security staff, emergency systems, and a caring community.

Home-Cooked Portuguese Favourites

Dining at Lar Rainha Santa Isabel is a thoughtfully curated experience that reflects the richness of Portuguese culinary tradition. Our rotating monthly menu balances variety and familiarity, offering beloved classics alongside seasonal inspirations. Meals are served in a comfortable communal space that encourages conversation, companionship, and a sense of belonging. Here, food nourishes both body and spirit.

Supporting Our Residents Through Every Purchase

The PWS Community Store is an on-site charity shop located at Lar Santa Isabel, dedicated to raising funds for our residents. All proceeds from sales go directly to our resident activity groups and improvement projects around the home.

What We Offer

Magusto Chestnut festival

​The Magusto Festival is a cherished annual event hosted by Lar Rainha Santa Isabel in Albertskroon, Johannesburg, celebrating Portuguese heritage and community spirit. First hosted in 2010, this vibrant festival is traditionally held in late November and features the roasting of chestnuts over open flames, filling the air with rich, earthy aromas. Attendees enjoy traditional Portuguese cuisine, lively music, and folk dancing, creating a warm and festive atmosphere. The event also serves as a significant fundraiser, with proceeds supporting the home's mission to provide compassionate care for its residents. The Magusto Festival not only honors cultural traditions but also brings together generations in a joyful celebration of community and giving.

Title: resident activities2
Content:
activities, fun & games

Dedicated to providing personalized support and companionship for our cherished senior residents.

Resident Activities

At Lar Santa Isabel, we believe that an active and engaging lifestyle is essential for the well-being of our residents. Through structured activities, we create opportunities for social interaction, mental stimulation, and physical wellness. Our weekly activity groups and biweekly pamper sessions provide residents with enjoyable experiences that enrich their daily lives, foster friendships, and promote a sense of fulfilment.

The Impact of Resident Activities

At Lar Santa Isabel, we recognize the importance of offering activities that engage the mind, body, and spirit. Our weekly activity groups and biweekly pamper sessions are more than just recreational pastimes; they contribute to the holistic well-being of our residents. By participating in creative, physical, and relaxing activities, residents experience numerous benefits, including:

• Enhanced Social Connections – Interacting with fellow residents fosters friendships and combats loneliness.
• Improved Mental Stimulation – Engaging in arts, crafts, and gardening stimulates cognitive functions and encourages creativity.
• Physical Well-being – Light exercise through gardening and sports promotes mobility and overall health.
• Emotional Wellness – Pamper sessions provide relaxation, reducing stress and enhancing mood.
• A Sense of Purpose – Creating art, growing plants, and participating in group activities instills a sense of accomplishment.

By maintaining a rich and varied activity program, we ensure that every resident at Lar Santa Isabel has the opportunity to enjoy meaningful and fulfilling experiences. Our commitment to fostering an engaging and supportive environment reflects our dedication to the happiness and well-being of those who call Lar Santa Isabel home.

Sky Group

A creative space where residents can explore various arts and crafts

Meninos do Jardim

Gardening Club is the perfect place to cultivate their love for plants

Weekly Activity Groups

Each week, residents are encouraged to participate in three engaging activity groups designed to nurture creativity, encourage light physical activity, and build a strong sense of community. These groups help residents maintain a healthy lifestyle while providing a supportive and enjoyable environment.

Sky Group

The Sky Group is a dedicated creative space where residents can explore various arts and crafts activities. Creativity is not only an enjoyable pastime but also a powerful tool for enhancing cognitive function, fine motor skills, and emotional expression. This group offers a relaxed and inspiring atmosphere where residents can paint, draw, knit, and engage in various crafting projects.

For many, arts and crafts serve as a way to reminisce, relive past experiences, and tell stories through creative expression. Whether painting a serene landscape, knitting a warm scarf, or decorating handmade greeting cards, each resident can contribute their unique artistic vision. The process of creating something by hand provides a sense of accomplishment and joy, reinforcing self-esteem and individuality.

In addition to its personal benefits, the Sky Group fosters a sense of camaraderie. Residents often share techniques, exchange ideas, and encourage one another throughout their creative journey. The friendly and supportive atmosphere makes every session a rewarding experience. Finished projects are sometimes displayed around Lar Santa Isabel or gifted to friends and family, adding an element of purpose and pride to the group’s efforts.

Paints (acrylic, watercolour, oil)
Paintbrushes (various sizes)

Craft glue & glue guns
Decorative paper & scrapbooking supplies

Meninos do Jardim

For those who find peace and fulfillment in nature, the Meninos do Jardim Gardening Club is the perfect place to cultivate their love for plants. Gardening is more than just a leisure activity; it has been shown to provide physical, emotional, and psychological benefits, making it an excellent addition to our weekly schedule.

Residents who participate in the Gardening Club take part in various activities, from planting flowers and herbs to tending vegetable patches. The act of nurturing a plant and watching it grow provides a profound sense of accomplishment and joy. Digging, planting, and watering offer gentle physical exercise, helping residents maintain mobility and dexterity.

Beyond the physical benefits, gardening is known for its calming effects. The sights, smells, and textures of nature create a soothing environment that reduces stress and anxiety. Many residents find solace in working with soil, caring for plants, and observing the natural beauty around them. Gardening also strengthens community bonds, as residents work together toward a shared goal, supporting and encouraging each other along the way.

The club also contributes to the beauty of Lar Santa Isabel, ensuring that our gardens remain lush and vibrant. Whether growing flowers that brighten up our outdoor spaces or cultivating fresh herbs for our kitchen, the Gardening Club plays an essential role in maintaining a lively and inviting environment.

Meninos do Jardim Wish list

Gardening gloves (various sizes)
Small hand trowels & spades
Watering cans & spray bottles
Flower & vegetable seeds
Seedling trays & pots
Compost & potting soil
Garden decorations (wind chimes, statues)
Garden kneeling pads & stools
Sun hats & aprons
Plant labels & markers

Sports Club

Physical activity is a crucial aspect of healthy aging, and our Sports Club offers a fun and engaging way for residents to stay active. This group provides opportunities for light exercise, social interaction, and friendly competition through activities such as golf games and, soon, lawn bowls.

Golf games are particularly popular among residents, offering a low-impact activity that helps improve hand-eye coordination and concentration. Mini-golf or putting challenges provide a sense of accomplishment and encourage strategic thinking, all while being enjoyable and accessible for residents of varying mobility levels.

Looking ahead, we are excited to introduce bowls to our Sports Club. Lawn bowls is a sport known for its inclusivity and adaptability, making it a perfect addition to our activities. It promotes balance, precision, and gentle movement, providing residents with an opportunity to engage in a friendly and social competition.

Participation in sports fosters camaraderie and teamwork, making it a valuable social experience. It helps residents build connections, stay physically active, and enjoy the thrill of the game in a supportive environment. Whether competing or simply enjoying the company of fellow residents, the Sports Club offers a wonderful way to maintain an active lifestyle.

Sports Club wish list

Mini golf set (putters, balls, mats)
Lawn bowls set
Mini Games
Yoga mats for light stretching

Pamper Sessions

In addition to our weekly activity groups, we provide biweekly pamper sessions to ensure our residents feel cared for and rejuvenated. These sessions are designed to promote relaxation, comfort, and self-care, offering a well-deserved moment of indulgence.

Manicures & Pedicures

Well-maintained hands and feet are not only aesthetically pleasing but also essential for personal hygiene and well-being. Our pamper sessions include professional-quality manicures and pedicures, where residents can enjoy nail trimming, shaping, and gentle polishing. These treatments help improve circulation, prevent common foot problems, and provide a refreshing experience.

Hand, Foot, and Head Massages

Massage therapy is a key component of our pamper sessions, helping residents experience relaxation and relief from tension. Hand and foot massages improve circulation, alleviate joint pain, and promote overall comfort. Head massages, in particular, help relieve stress, reduce headaches, and improve sleep quality.

These massages are performed in a serene and calming setting, allowing residents to fully unwind. The power of touch has profound therapeutic effects, enhancing both physical relaxation and emotional well-being. Many residents eagerly anticipate these sessions, as they provide an opportunity to de-stress and feel pampered.

Gentle Facials

Our pamper sessions also include gentle facials, which cleanse, hydrate, and refresh the skin. Using mild, nourishing products suitable for all skin types, these facials help maintain healthy skin while providing a soothing experience.

Facial treatments promote relaxation, reduce dryness, and improve skin elasticity. The process of gentle cleansing and moisturizing is not only beneficial for the skin but also enhances overall comfort and well-being. Residents enjoy the calming effects of these treatments, leaving them feeling rejuvenated and refreshed.

Nail polish (various colors)
Nail files & clippers
Hand & foot creams
Essential oils (lavender, peppermint, eucalyptus)
Massage oils & lotions
Soft towels & blankets
Facial masks & gentle cleansers
Comfortable massage chairs or cushions
Bluetooth Speaker for relaxing music player

The power of touch has profound therapeutic effects, enhancing both physical relaxation and emotional well-being. Library & Reading Room

Lar Santa Isabel boasts a spacious library and cozy reading room designed to inspire curiosity and foster lifelong learning. Our extensive collection includes Portuguese and English books spanning genres such as fiction, history, poetry, and biographies. Residents are encouraged to borrow books, immerse themselves in quiet moments of reading, or engage in occasional book discussions that promote intellectual stimulation and connection. The reading room provides a peaceful retreat for reflection, study, or relaxation, making it a treasured part of the home. Whether exploring literature or simply enjoying the ambiance, residents find joy and enrichment in this welcoming space

Chapel & Religious Services

Lar Santa Isabel is home to a beautiful on-site chapel, a place of serenity where residents can nurture their spiritual well-being and connect with their faith. The chapel holds regular Mass services, creating a rhythm of reflection and worship that is central to the community’s sense of belonging. Beyond the structured services, the space is open to residents for quiet prayer, meditation, or simply finding peace in its tranquil atmosphere. The chapel is not only a place for religious practice but also a reminder of shared values and traditions, fostering spiritual comfort and strengthening the bond among all who call Lar Santa Isabel home

Title: Our Home
Content:
Community, Care & Comfort

Lar Rainha Santa Isabel

Lar Rainha Santa Isabel is a residential care facility operated by the Portuguese Welfare Society, located in Albertskroon, Johannesburg. Established in the early 1990s through the transformation of an old school building, the Lar was born from a need to accommodate the growing number of elderly Portuguese citizens in need of care and housing.

The facility currently offers care for up to 100 senior residents, with a range of accommodation options including Independent Living, Midcare (Intermediate Care), and Frailcare. Of the residents, over 50% cannot afford full board and lodging and are supported through the charitable work of PWS and its donors.

The home is a community project in every sense. It employs over 57 staff members – predominantly women – who work in rotating shifts to provide 24-hour care and support. In recent years, Lar Santa Isabel has expanded to include a dedicated Frailcare Unit with 23 beds, as well as a Intermediate Care section consisting of 12 individual rooms, a treatment room, lounge, kitchen, and staff facilities. A new administrative block was also developed at the entrance of the property to streamline operations and better serve families and visitors.

Lar Santa Isabel is not just a place to live – it is a nurturing, Portuguese-speaking community filled with care, companionship, and a deep cultural connection.

our Care levels

Frailcare

For seniors who require round-the-clock medical attention and assistance with daily activities.

Read More

Midcare

Our staff is available to help with personal care, meals, and medication management in a secure setting.

Read More

Independent Living

For seniors who can manage most daily activities on their own but may require occasional assistance.

Read More

Flatlets

Enjoy the freedom of self-sufficient living in our comfortable, well-equipped stand-alone units.

Read More

24/7 CCTV security

Lar Rainha Santa Isabel is protected by 24-hour CCTV and on-site security, with controlled access for everyone’s safety. The grounds are fully fenced for added peace of mind.
Each resident also has a panic button in their room, linked directly to our security team, so help is always just a press away.

Wheelchair Friendly Living

Our entire facility is thoughtfully designed to be fully wheelchair accessible. From smooth pathways to spacious bathrooms and ramps throughout, we make mobility easy and safe. Whether indoors or outdoors, residents can move freely and comfortably, because independence should never have limits.

Weekly Doctor's Visits

A local GP visits Lar Rainha Santa Isabel every week to check on residents' health and wellbeing. Routine care is delivered on-site, making it easy for residents to stay on top of their health without leaving the comfort of their home. It’s just one more way we put care within easy reach.

Engaging Activities & Community Life

Social gatherings and cultural
events

Celebrate life with familiar traditions, joyful moments, and a vibrant calendar filled with Portuguese culture and connection.

Recreational and wellness
programs

Stay active, engaged, and thriving with fun activities and personalized wellness designed for joyful, healthy living.

Feel uplifted and connected through compassionate spiritual care and meaningful community ties that nourish the soul.

Meninos do Jardim

For those who find peace and fulfillment in nature, the Meninos do Jardim Gardening Club is the perfect place to cultivate their love for plants. Gardening is more than just a leisure activity; it has been shown to provide physical, emotional, and psychological benefits, making it an excellent addition to our weekly schedule.

Residents who participate in the Gardening Club take part in various activities, from planting flowers and herbs to tending vegetable patches. The act of nurturing a plant and watching it grow provides a profound sense of accomplishment and joy. Digging, planting, and watering offer gentle physical exercise, helping residents maintain mobility and dexterity.

Beyond the physical benefits, gardening is known for its calming effects. The sights, smells, and textures of nature create a soothing environment that reduces stress and anxiety. Many residents find solace in working with soil, caring for plants, and observing the natural beauty around them. Gardening also strengthens community bonds, as residents work together toward a shared goal, supporting and encouraging each other along the way.

The club also contributes to the beauty of Lar Santa Isabel, ensuring that our gardens remain lush and vibrant. Whether growing flowers that brighten up our outdoor spaces or cultivating fresh herbs for our kitchen, the Gardening Club plays an essential role in maintaining a lively and inviting environment.

Sports Club

Physical activity is a crucial aspect of healthy aging, and our Sports Club offers a fun and engaging way for residents to stay active. This group provides opportunities for light exercise, social interaction, and friendly competition through activities such as golf games and, soon, lawn bowls.

Golf games are particularly popular among residents, offering a low-impact activity that helps improve hand-eye coordination and concentration. Mini-golf or putting challenges provide a sense of accomplishment and encourage strategic thinking, all while being enjoyable and accessible for residents of varying mobility levels.

Looking ahead, we are excited to introduce bowls to our Sports Club. Lawn bowls is a sport known for its inclusivity and adaptability, making it a perfect addition to our activities. It promotes balance, precision, and gentle movement, providing residents with an opportunity to engage in a friendly and social competition.

Participation in sports fosters camaraderie and teamwork, making it a valuable social experience. It helps residents build connections, stay physically active, and enjoy the thrill of the game in a supportive environment. Whether competing or simply enjoying the company of fellow residents, the Sports Club offers a wonderful way to maintain an active lifestyle.

Sports Club wish list

Mini golf set (putters, balls, mats)
Lawn bowls set
Mini Games
Yoga mats for light stretching

Pamper Sessions

In addition to our weekly activity groups, we provide biweekly pamper sessions to ensure our residents feel cared for and rejuvenated. These sessions are designed to promote relaxation, comfort, and self-care, offering a well-deserved moment of indulgence.

Manicures & Pedicures

Well-maintained hands and feet are not only aesthetically pleasing but also essential for personal hygiene and well-being. Our pamper sessions include professional-quality manicures and pedicures, where residents can enjoy nail trimming, shaping, and gentle polishing. These treatments help improve circulation, prevent common foot problems, and provide a refreshing experience.

Hand, Foot, and Head Massages

Massage therapy is a key component of our pamper sessions, helping residents experience relaxation and relief from tension. Hand and foot massages improve circulation, alleviate joint pain, and promote overall comfort. Head massages, in particular, help relieve stress, reduce headaches, and improve sleep quality.

These massages are performed in a serene and calming setting, allowing residents to fully unwind. The power of touch has profound therapeutic effects, enhancing both physical relaxation and emotional well-being. Many residents eagerly anticipate these sessions, as they provide an opportunity to de-stress and feel pampered.

Gentle Facials

Our pamper sessions also include gentle facials, which cleanse, hydrate, and refresh the skin. Using mild, nourishing products suitable for all skin types, these facials help maintain healthy skin while providing a soothing experience.

Facial treatments promote relaxation, reduce dryness, and improve skin elasticity. The process of gentle cleansing and moisturizing is not only beneficial for the skin but also enhances overall comfort and well-being. Residents enjoy the calming effects of these treatments, leaving them feeling rejuvenated and refreshed.

Comfortable massage chairs or cushions

Bluetooth Speaker for relaxing music player
Massage oils & lotions

Library & Reading Room

Lar Santa Isabel boasts a spacious library and cozy reading room designed to inspire curiosity and foster lifelong learning. Our extensive collection includes Portuguese and English books spanning genres such as fiction, history, poetry, and biographies. Residents are encouraged to borrow books, immerse themselves in quiet moments of reading, or engage in occasional book discussions that promote intellectual stimulation and connection. The reading room provides a peaceful retreat for reflection, study, or relaxation, making it a treasured part of the home. Whether exploring literature or simply enjoying the ambiance, residents find joy and enrichment in this welcoming space

Chapel & Religious Services

Lar Santa Isabel is home to a beautiful on-site chapel, a place of serenity where residents can nurture their spiritual well-being and connect with their faith. The chapel holds regular Mass services, creating a rhythm of reflection and worship that is central to the community’s sense of belonging. Beyond the structured services, the space is open to residents for quiet prayer, meditation, or simply finding peace in its tranquil atmosphere. The chapel is not only a place for religious practice but also a reminder of shared values and traditions, fostering spiritual comfort and strengthening the bond among all who call Lar Santa Isabel home
